required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PCSK9 Inhibitor on ACS Patients With Multivessel Disease and Relatively Low LDL-C Level in Chinese Population
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of PCSK9 Inhibitor on Acute Coronary Syndrome Patients With Multivessel Disease and Relatively Low LDL-C Level in Chinese Population (CHOICE Study)

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

clinical_study.source: Second Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

brief_summary.textblock:
The study is an open-label, multicenter, and randomized study. The objective of this study is to demonstrate the effect of PCSK9 inhibitor on ACS patients with multivessel disease and relatively low LDL-C levels or LDL-C levels lower than the recommended target.
The primary outcome was the rate of major adverse cardiac events (CV death, non-fatal myocardial infarction, documented unstable angina that requires admission into a hospital, all coronary revascularization with either PCI or CABG occurring at least 30 days after randomization, Non-fatal stroke) at 1 year. The secondary efficacy endpoints were individual components of the major adverse cardiac events, all cause death, and the percent change in LDL-C, Apo B, HDL-C, Lp(a) after treatment.

primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint in the CHOICE study was the rate of major adverse cardiac events at 1 year. The definition of major adverse cardiac events was a composite of: CV death Major coronary events 1) non-fatal myocardial infarction [MI]; 2)documented unstable angina that requires admission into a hospital; 3)all coronary revascularization with either PCI or CABG occurring at least 30 days after randomization) Non-fatal stroke

secondary_outcome.description: The secondary efficacy endpoints were individual components of the major adverse cardiac events, all cause death, and the percent change in LDL-C, Apo B, HDL-C, Lp(a) at 1 year.
the percent change in LDL-C, Apo B, HDL-C, Lp(a) at 1 year.

arm_group.description: Standard of care: management as recommended in ESC/EAS 2019 guidelines, within reimbursement criteria
On top of Standard of care, Evolocumab (Repatha®) 140 mg or Alirocumab(Praluent) 75mg every two weeks: first subcutaneous injection at the time of randomization, followings during 12 months.

intervention.description: Evolocumab (Repatha®) 140 mg or Alirocumab (Praluent) 75mg every two weeks, first subcutaneous injection at the time of randomization, followings during 12 months

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Second Xiangya Hospital of Central South University
responsible_party.investigator_title: Director, Head of cardiovascular department, Principal Investigator
